snippet: Even with the decision to supply lethal aid to the rebels, the Obama administration remains deeply divided about whether to take more forceful action to try to quell the fighting.
abstract: American officials say Obama administration, concluding that troops of Syrian Pres al-Assad have used chemical weapons against rebel forces in country's civil war, has decided to begin supplying rebels for first time with small arms and ammunition; administration remains deeply divided about whether to take more forceful action to try to quell fighting.

byline.original: By MARK MAZZETTI, MICHAEL R. GORDON and MARK LANDLER

lead_paragraph: Even with the decision to supply lethal aid to the rebels, the Obama administration remains deeply divided about whether to take more forceful action to try to quell the fighting.

headline.main: U.S. Is Said to Plan to Send Weapons to Syrian Rebels
headline.print_headline: U.S. Is Said to Plan to Send Weapons to Syrian Rebels
